meanings.definition: Resembling a chasm; gaping or wide.
meanings.sent1: The chasmy canyon stretched out before us, its vastness taking our breath away.
meanings.sent2: The landscape was chasmy, with deep valleys and towering cliffs.
meanings.sent3: The chasmy road ahead seemed to yawn like a sleepy giant, ready to swallow us whole.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like chasmy pools, deep and mysterious, drawing me in.
meanings.sent5: The chasmy sky at dusk painted a picture of endless possibilities.

meanings.definition: Full of chasms; marked by deep fissures or gaps.
meanings.sent1: The chasmy terrain was treacherous, with hidden gaps waiting to trap the unwary traveler.
meanings.sent2: The old castle stood on a chasmy cliff, its foundation riddled with cracks and crevices.
meanings.sent3: The chasmy ground seemed to play a game of hide-and-seek with anyone daring to cross it.
meanings.sent4: His chasmy thoughts mirrored the fractured landscape, full of hidden depths and uncertainties.
meanings.sent5: The chasmy walls of the ancient ruins whispered secrets of the past.
